Detailed Description

template<class Lock>
class cds::lock::scoped_lock< Lock >

Scoped lock.

An object of type scoped_lock controls the ownership of a lockable object within a scope. A scoped_lock object maintains ownership of a lockable object throughout the scoped_lock objectâ€™s lifetime. The behavior of a program is undefined if the lockable object does not exist for the entire lifetime of the scoped_lock object. The supplied Lock type shall have two methods: lock and unlock.

The constructor locks the wrapped lock object, the destructor unlocks it.

Scoped lock is not copy-constructible and not default-constructible.

This class is similar to std::lock_quard

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<class Lock >
cds::lock::scoped_lock< Lock >::scoped_lock ( lock_type &  l,
bool  bAlreadyLocked 
)
inline

Get ownership of lock object l and conditionally locks it.

The constructor calls l.lock() only if bAlreadyLocked is false. If bAlreadyLocked is true, no locking is performed.

In any case, the destructor of scoped_lock object invokes l.unlock().
